clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Plasma Non-coding RNAs as Biomarkers in Coronary Heart Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Plasma Non-coding RNAs (miRNA-320a) as Biomarkers of Diagnosis, Prognosis and Treatment Effects in Coronary Heart Disease

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether the expression level of miR-320a are effective as biomarker in evaluating the diagnosis, prognosis and treatment effects of coronary heart disease.

primary_outcome.measure: the plasma expression of miR-320a in coronary heart disease patients compared to control patients

secondary_outcome.measure: number of participants with cardiovascular causes of death
number of participants with non fatal myocardial infarction or stroke
number of participants with re-hospitalization due to cardiovascular causes
number of participants with all causes of mortality
number of participants with myocardial infarction re-exacerbation or re-hospitalization

arm_group.arm_group_label: patients with coronary heart disease symptoms

intervention.arm_group_label: patients with coronary heart disease symptoms

study_pop.textblock: 4000 outpatients or hospitalized patients with coronary heart diseasewill be enrolled in this study.
